column2: Successful Estimator display strong Estimation, analytical, problem-solving, organizational, and written/oral communication skills. They should be detail-oriented team members who can consistently meet deadlines and possess the ability to work independently as needed. Computer, interpersonal and customer service skills are necessary. The Senior Estimator will be responsible for leading cost estimates and proposals related to design build construction involving transportation and heavy-civil infrastructure. This position will work closely with the Chief Estimator to produce accurate, detailed cost estimates and provide preconstruction support for assigned projects. Manage workload scheduling for timely completion of deliverables.         Responsible for compliance with estimating methodology to produce high quality estimates.         Lead project team review for estimating quantities and scope of project.         Responsible for reviewing and approving quotes on bonds and insurance. column2: The    Proposal Coordinator    is responsible for producing high quality winning proposals to an existing or prospective client, on time and within budget. They ensure that all the clients questions have been answered as fully as possible, and that the organization has given itself the best possible chance of success.     The role involves coordinating all day-to-day aspects of each individual bid/proposal (primarily in the APAC region), responding to the proposal requirements using existing library content, as well as developing and maintaining the content repositories.      This is a starting role that provides a great opportunity to join a winning team, gain deeper product and industry knowledge by representing our award-winning software platform, and grow your career in sales, solution consulting, marketing, project management, account management, or business development. Review old content on a regular basis with subject matter experts (Content Audits)     Make sure that the answers are always up to date, relevant, accurate.             Coordinate proposal printing, assembling, mailing/shipping as required. Be able to work on multiple projects, balancing milestones, and due dates. column2: Shift timings:US Shift Experience Level:5-7 Years Job Responsibilities The primary purpose of this role will be to lead and deliver enterprise wide procurement and cost optimization opportunities, capturing cost reductions on Collaberas expenditures for indirect goods and services while assisting the Executive Director, Global Procurement with procurement strategy, processes and execution. The Strategic Sourcing and procurement Specialist will lead the planning and execution of strategic sourcing initiatives using a multi-step sourcing process for prioritized indirect spend categories within Corporate Services categories including but not limited to IT Hardware & Software, Facility Services, HR Recruiting, Contingent Labor, Background & drug screening, Office Supplies, and Travel. The Specialist will develop category specifications requirements and related scope of work that is consistent with the business requirements and Global Procurement strategy. S/He will conduct data gathering, spend analytics, and utilizes market intelligence to develop business cases and total cost of ownership models to assist the Business Units(BU) in delivering measurable cost savings and developing multi-year cost avoidance and reduction strategies while conducting analytics to measure and monitor savings achieved and ensure category compliance versus previously implemented procurement initiatives The Specialist will lead evaluations through the development of RFQ, RFI and RFPs and participate in negotiations. This position will develop negotiation strategies based on supplier proposals and spend/RFP analysis and act as a contract negotiator within assigned categories. S/He will manage supplier selection process and provide data and recommendations to ensure informed selection decisions and develop and administer agreements and statements of work in collaboration with business and legal department. Additionally, this position will identify continuous improvement initiatives such as demand management and process improvements while monitoring supply market and identifying opportunities resulting from new product offerings and/or market shifts (e.g., entry or exit of suppliers, changes in pricing). Required Skills Minimum of 5 to 7 years of strong category and general procurement experience Experience leading all stages of a structured strategic sourcing process for indirect spend categories across multiple spend areas Knowledge of contract fundamentals Excellent math, analytical, problem solving and project management skills Strong interpersonal and communication skills Demonstrated ability to work with suppliers Strong relationship management experience Self-starter with the ability to work independently with minimal supervision Ability to drive projects with a sense of urgency and perform in a fast paced organization with time sensitive deliverables Proficient in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, Word and knowledge of Procurement tools Ability to interact with all levels of Management Ability and willing to work flexible hours Qualifications Bachelors in Finance, Economics, or Supply Management

column2: Role & responsibilities:    Identify, evaluate, and select suppliers, subcontractors, and vendors for MEP materials, equipment, and services. This involves researching potential suppliers, negotiating terms and prices, and establishing long-term relationships to ensure timely and cost-effective procurement. Receive and review material requisitions from project managers, engineers, and other stakeholders to determine procurement requirements. Collaborate with internal teams to understand specifications, quantities, and delivery schedules. Prepare and issue Requests for Quotation (RFQs) to selected suppliers, subcontractors, and vendors. Evaluate received quotations based on factors such as price, quality, lead time, and terms of delivery. Coordinate with relevant departments for technical evaluation and selection criteria. Generate purchase orders (POs) based on approved quotations and negotiated terms. Ensure accuracy of PO details, including quantities, specifications, prices, delivery dates, and terms of payment. Communicate POs to suppliers and subcontractors and track order status until delivery. Negotiate contracts, terms, and conditions with suppliers and subcontractors to secure favorable pricing, payment terms, and service levels. Maintain contract documentation and ensure compliance with contractual obligations throughout the procurement process. Monitor inventory levels of critical MEP materials and equipment to prevent stockouts and delays in project execution. Coordinate with project teams to forecast material requirements and maintain optimal inventory levels to meet project schedules. Monitor supplier performance, including delivery timeliness, product quality, and adherence to contractual agreements. Address any issues or discrepancies promptly and work with suppliers to implement corrective actions and improve performance. Analyze procurement costs, expenditures, and budget variances to identify cost-saving opportunities and optimize procurement processes. Work closely with finance and project management teams to ensure alignment with project budgets and financial objectives. Coordinate logistics and transportation arrangements for incoming materials and equipment deliveries to project sites. Ensure timely and efficient transportation while minimizing costs and risks associated with transit. Ensure compliance with company policies, procurement procedures, industry regulations, and legal requirements related to procurement activities. Maintain accurate and up-to-date procurement records, documentation, and reports for audit purposes. Overall, as a Purchase Executive in an MEP contracting company, your role is critical in facilitating the procurement of materials, equipment, and services essential for successful project execution. By effectively managing the procurement process, you contribute to project efficiency, cost control, and client satisfaction. Preferred candidate profile: Experienced into procurement of HVAC/ MEP equipments WhatsApp resume at 8657740446
column11: Purchase, HVAC, Procurement, MEP purchase, Vendor Development, Vendor Negotiation, HVAC purchase, MEP

column2: The Procurement Coordinator is responsible for securing (onboarding and setting up) external fieldwork suppliers for quantitative and qualitative projects     They will assist the Fieldwork Coordinators and Project Managers in ensuring the projects are delivered in accordance with the specifications, budget, and timelines given by our clients     This position is ideal for a candidate who is a strong multi-tasker, enjoys building partnerships with vendors, is budget conscious and enjoys a fast-paced environment               Essential Duties and Responsibilities:         Candidate will work closely with Project Management, Procurement, and Fieldwork teams to meet project needs for various methodologies and markets.     Gather feedback, costs, and feasibility from external fieldwork suppliers after internal project kick-off is completed.     Responsible for reviewing projects before setting up external fieldwork suppliers, to ensure that all internal fieldwork strategies have been explored, and budget permits additional project costs.     Commission and set up external fieldwork suppliers on projects when requested by the fieldwork coordinator or project manager. Candidate is responsible for recording the suppliers costs at commissioning and closing stage in M3 cost tracking system.     Set up external fieldwork suppliers in a timely manner to ensure that the projects are completed within timelines stipulated by the client and introduce them to the Fieldwork Coordinator or Project Manager.     Work with the internal teams on backup plans when external suppliers are not able to reach their target for a project.     Review and rate external fieldwork suppliers performances at the end of fieldwork.     Communicate effectively with external suppliers and internal teams, including escalation control and feedback.     Ensure final updates are sent to external suppliers and costs approved before allowing them to issue an invoice.     Negotiate cost adjustments as needed based on performance or changes in field.     Pro-actively look for alternative suppliers (sourcing) to expand M3 Global Research supplier network and present to procurement leadership team for review and vetting.     Monitor costs and performance of external suppliers over time to develop priority based on cost efficiency and feasibility.     Monitor and adhere to ISO requirements for supplier compliance. Assist with compliance documentation and audits as needed.     Update partner information, changes, or paperwork in internal partner tracking system.         Essential Job functions         Maintain regular and punctual attendance     Work cooperatively with others     Comply with all company policies and procedures.         Profile Summary / Business Unit Mission   :     Candidate will be required to work in US shift timings, and coordinate with Fieldwork and Project managers, as well as external vendors.       Competencies   :       Clear Communication - Oral and Written     Takes Initiative     Self-Driven     Accountable     Solutions Oriented     Problem solving     Competency with Numbers         Knowledge, Skill, Ability   :       Proficient at Excel     Ability to multi-task     Can work within budgets and different currencies     Be able to work as part of a team and show flexibility in the tasks they are asked to perform     Independently motivated and inspired by working in a dynamic environment     Comfortable with change, ability to derive opportunity from uncertainty     Analytical and strategic thinker     Ensure accuracy and display excellent attention to detail     Responsive and able to work well under pressure and in a fast-paced environment     Solution Orientated     Ability to foster partnerships with our vendors     Organizational skills as the role involves working on a variety of projects and deadlines to generate effective results     Enjoy working with and comfortable with large amounts of data       Qualifications            Bachelors Degree

column2: Assistant Purchasing Manager        (      Job Number:          HOT0ADOG    )          Work Locations      :          Hilton Garden Inn Surat City Center            C. S.  No.  39+57+58/P+86/A/P,  Ward No.  7,  Moje                    Surat        395006                    An Assistant Purchasing Manager will ensure the accuracy of stocks,  accounts payable,  prepayments,  and creditor/accruals accounting records and provide periodic reports to the Finance department.           What will I be doing?          As Assistant Purchasing Manager,  you will ensure the accuracy of stocks,  accounts payable,  prepayments,  and creditor/accruals accounting records and provide periodic reports to the Finance department.  Specifically,  you will be responsible for performing the following tasks to the highest standards:      Ensure purchasing of all goods and equipment required by the hotel.     Purchase the correct goods and materials at a competitive price and proper quantities/volumes.     Generate regular reports on goods purchased and inventory levels so to allow for more effective future purchasing.     Report all monthly savings to the hotel Team.     Work with hotel management to improve the purchasing process as a way to reduce waste and improve profitability.     Maintain good communication and working relationships with all hotel areas.     Attend finance meetings,  as required.     Act in accordance with fire,  health and safety regulations and follow the correct procedures when required.     Serve your role and Team in an environmentally-conscience manner.                         What are we looking for?          An Assistant Purchasing Manager serving Hilton brands is always working on behalf of our Guests and working with other Team Members.  To successfully fill this role,  you should maintain the attitude,  behaviours,  skills,  and values that follow:      Previous experience in a high-volume Accounts function    Computer literate,  with good MS Excel skills    Good time management and organisation skills      It would be advantageous in this position for you to demonstrate the following capabilities and distinctions:      Relevant degree,  in Finance/Accounting or related business discipline,  from an academic institution            What will it be like to work for Hilton?          Hilton is the leading global hospitality company,  spanning the lodging sector from luxurious full-service hotels and resorts to extended-stay suites and mid-priced hotels.  For nearly a century,  Hilton has offered business and leisure travelers the finest in accommodations,  service,  amenities and value.  Hilton is dedicated to continuing its tradition of providing exceptional guest experiences across its  global brands .   Our vision  to fill the earth with the light and warmth of hospitality  unites us as a team to create remarkable hospitality experiences around the world every day.   And,  our amazing Team Members are at the heart of it all!                                Job      :        Supply Management,  Procurement,  Purchasing,  and Receiving          Schedule      :        Full-time

N   Relocation?  N   Position Type  Non-Management       POSITION SUMMARY         Print and organize various necessary documents, summarize relevant information, and distribute information to appropriate employees. Maintain up-to-date knowledge of company safety programs within assigned area of responsibility, (e.g., food, retail), as well as all local, state, and federal regulations. Adhere to food safety and handling policies and procedures across all food-related areas. Maintain clear and organized records to ensure all reports and invoices are filed and stored properly. Calculate figures for inventories, orders, and costs. Conduct inventory audits to determine inventory levels and needs. Notify manager/supervisor of low stock levels. Troubleshoot vendor delivery issues and oversee return process. Verify and track received inventory. Reconcile shipping invoices and receiving reports. Receive, unload, and process deliveries. Monitor PAR levels for all food items to ensure proper levels. Refuse acceptance of damaged, unacceptable, or incorrect items.       Assist management in training, scheduling, counseling, disciplining, and motivating and coaching employees; serve as a role model. Ensure adherence to quality expectations and standards. Report accidents, injuries, and unsafe work conditions to manager; complete safety training and certifications. Follow all company policies and procedures; ensure uniform and personal appearance are clean and professional; maintain confidentiality of proprietary information; protect company assets. Assist other employees to ensure proper coverage and prompt guest service. Speak with others using clear and professional language; prepare and review written documents accurately and completely. Develop and maintain positive working relationships with others; support team to reach common goals; listen and respond appropriately to the concerns of other employees. Read and visually verify information in a variety of formats (e.g., small print). Stand, sit, or walk for an extended period of time or for an entire work shift. Move, lift, carry, push, pull, and place objects weighing less than or equal to 50 pounds without assistance. Grasp, turn, and manipulate objects of varying size and weight, requiring fine motor skills and hand-eye coordination. Move through narrow, confined, or elevated spaces. Move over sloping, uneven, or slippery surfaces as well as up and stairs and/or service ramps. Perform other reasonable job duties as requested. We re looking for achievers who are passionate about providing a guest experience that goes above and beyond, enjoy being part of a small yet ambitious team, and love learning how to always improve - all while having fun. column2: Control Tower Executive Supply Chain    ??ontrol Tower Executive Supply Chain    Job Description:    Control Tower Supply Chain is a central (Pan India) monitoring unit functioning within the supply chain division of Jumbotail and will be located in Bangalore.    As Control Tower Executive Supply Chain you will be responsible for complete oversight of supply chain operations across different legs First Mile,  Line Haul Logistics,  Fulfilment Centre and Last Mile deliveries,  Professionals in this role not only need to ensure smooth and timely functioning of supply chain across various locations but also need to help in providing un- parallel delivery experience to the customers    In the First Mile:    ??Support the First Mile team by providing visibility and insights by    setting up process adherence checks and publishing metrics to first mile team    first- mile pick sheet generation based on capacity available and inventory position.    Co- ordinate and follow- up on returns to sellers/ vendors ensuring items are received in the right quantity and quality.    Co- ordinate for all exceptions with biz ops and FC Ops and resolve them on regular basis.    ??This team will also track manpower and vehicle fleet performance in First Mile In the Fulfillment Center:    ??Work with Biz Ops for ensuring ASN compliance and ASN adherence    ??Build checks in inward process,  ensure all inwards are done within SLA and accurately    ??Track put- away process and ensure timely in- stock of goods. Supervise cycle counting and inventory correction activity.    Track and publish productivity report for inward,  put away,  picking,  dispatch executives.    Conduct complete RCA on fill rate issues and publish reports    ??Track expired and slow- moving stock with the help of ground operations.    ??Follow- up with business team to ensure timely liquidation and return vendor    ??Track manpower and vehicle fleet performance in First Mile In the Last Mile:    ??Ensure process adherence and follow- up with ground team to provide an unparalleled delivery experience to customers.    first level escalation in case of any process failures. Ensure the performance is met and    provide support and guidance in case of any lag. on performance for different locations-  DCs.    ??Co- ordinate with KAM/ VAM/ CD/ FC/ FM and resolve customer escalations.    ??Responsible for Last mile planning and routes planning across Distribution Centres using route planning software.    follow up on ,  returns,  re- attempts,  return pickups,  goods replacement and damages exceptions    ??Ensure on- time manpower reporting and vehicle reporting. Work with capacity team to ensure adhoc requests are met to safeguard customer interest.    vehicle capacity planning,  raising requests for ad- hoc capacity when needed across first mile,  last mile and line haul.    ??Work with on- boarded vendors to resolve all driver related issues faced on the ground    ??Overview timely reporting and SLA adherence by all vehicles. Ensure complete reconciliation of logistics MIS.    daily report on vehicle reporting time,  vehicle capacity and time utilization    Requirements: We are looking for leaders at all levels who have the hunger to work with some of the smartest people,  who are driven by a sense of purpose,  and who wish to leave a legacy in their respective domains and among their professional fraternity. We are not just building apps or tech platforms,  but rather building distributed ecosystems connected through intelligent technology that can change the face of the food and grocery consumption pipelines in India,  forever,  for the better.    An ideal candidate for this role is someone who has-     ??Graduate from a well- known university ( Under- graduate with decent work experience can also apply)    ??Ability to perform multiple tasks,  adjust quickly in short time frame with limited direct supervision    ??Ability to create rapport with others and build a team environment    ??Ability to work flexible hours if necessary (all shifts)    ??Strong written and verbal communication,  organizational,  motivational and time management skills    ??Excellent Facilitation skills    ??Should be well versed with Excel,  power point presentation Basic Knowledge of SQL    ??Prior working knowledge in Analytics using Analytic tools will be an added advantage We would like to hear from candidates who have the hunger to impact real lives and who can match our high bar on that we live by. If you-     ??can apply first principles thinking to solve problems    ??can envision a great future that you want to create    ??have the fire in your belly to get out of your cube and do something about your vision and passion    ??want to work with some really smart people,  and still raise the bar for all of us    ??can have fun and help your colleagues have fun doing all of the above..

column2: The Purchase Manager will lead and oversee the procurement process for our real estate and construction projects. The ideal candidate should possess 8-15 years of procurement experience, with a strong focus on the construction and materials industry. We offer a competitive salary reflective of industry standards. Responsibilities: Procurement Planning: Collaborate with project managers to comprehend procurement requirements. Gain a thorough understanding of the requirements and technical requirements of the product or service. Develop procurement plans for timely and cost-effective material, equipment, and service procurement. Conduct market research to identify potential suppliers and maintain a robust supplier database. Supplier Management: Evaluate suppliers based on quality, reliability, and cost-effectiveness. Negotiate and manage supplier contracts. Monitor supplier performance, resolving any issues promptly. Cultivate strong relationships with suppliers for material and service availability. Updating of supplier database with the latest entrants and the evolving technologies relevant to the industry Purchase Order Management: Review and convert purchase requisitions into accurate and complete purchase orders. Monitor and track purchase orders to ensure on-time delivery. Coordinate with project teams and suppliers to resolve delivery or quality issues. Cost Management: Analyze market trends, prices, and supplier performance for cost-saving opportunities. Implement cost control measures without compromising quality. Conduct periodic audits for compliance with procurement policies. Analyze every material or product to ensure the pricing is appropriate for the product procured. Inventory Management: Manage inventory levels for optimal stock availability. Coordinate with warehouse and project teams to track and reconcile inventory. Implement inventory control measures to minimize stock-outs and excess inventory. Compliance and Documentation: Ensure compliance with company policies, procurement regulations, and applicable laws. Maintain accurate procurement records and documentation. Prepare reports and provide updates on procurement activities to management. Qualifications: 1 - 5 years of procurement experience in the real estate or construction industry. Residential purchase experience is essential. Strong Proficiency in MS Office (Excel, Word). Experience in preparing MIS reports as per management requirements. Strong knowledge of procurement processes, vendor management, and supply chain management. Excellent negotiation and communication skills. Proficient in procurement software (ERP) and other relevant tools. BE, BTech or Master's degree in Business Administration, Supply Chain Management, or a related field (preferred). Good Analytical skills to review the quotations and understand the intricacies. Financial acumen to grasp the impact of procurement decisions on the overall budget. Strategic thinking to develop and implement cost-effective procurement plans that align with the organization's goals. Maintaining  ethical standards  in procurement practices ensures transparency, fairness, and integrity, which is crucial for long-term success and cost management. Being adaptable to changes in the market, industry regulations, or organizational priorities allows for agility in adjusting procurement strategies for optimal cost management. Good understanding on National Building Code (NBC) of construction

column2: Developing, leading and executing purchasing strategies Track and report key functional metrics to reduce expenses   and improve effectiveness. Forecast price and market trends to identify changes of   balance in buyer-supplier power. Perform cost and scenario analysis, and benchmarking. Seek and partner with reliable vendors and suppliers. Determine quantity and timing of deliveries. Monitor and forecast upcoming levels of demand. Maintain records of goods ordered and received. Locate vendors of materials, equipment or supplies, and   interview them in order to determine product availability and terms of sales. Prepare and process requisitions and purchase orders for   supplies and equipment. Control purchasing department budgets. Review purchase order claims and contracts for conformance   to company policy. Analyze market and delivery systems in order to assess   present and future material availability. Resolve vendor or contractor grievances, and claims against   suppliers. Represent companies in negotiating contracts and   formulating policies with suppliers. Review, evaluate, and approve specifications for issuing   and awarding bids. Prepare reports regarding market conditions and merchandise   costs. Administer on-line purchasing systems. Arrange for disposal of surplus materials.

column2: Entero Healthcare Solutions About us : Did you know that India has 8 Lakh+ chemists, more than 60k+ distributors and still more than 30% of prescriptions go unfulfilled or partially fulfilled in our country every day.  We at Entero has been trying to change that by building a robust tech driven supply chain which helps chemists in stocking better and improving the prescription fill rates. We have scaled up from zero to 4000 Cr annual revenue (Actual Revenues, Not GMV) in last 5 years, we are a trusted supply chain partner to more than 84k+ chemists and 3400+ hospitals across 495+ districts as on today. We are also healthcare supply chain partner for more than 1900 healthcare companies both MNCs and Indian.    Best Part, We are a profitable company (Yes Net profit positive, not contribution margin or order level positive). We understand the need for high growth rates and hunt for it, but basic metrics of doing everything with a sharp eye on profitability is what makes us unique. You can visit our website: www.enterohealthcare.com    Position: Purchase Executive for OTC Products Location: Hyderabad Reporting to: Unit Head Position Overview:  We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Purchase Executive for our procurement operations and optimize our purchasing processes with one of our entities in Hyderabad.  Key Responsibilities: Supplier Management:  Identify and qualify reliable suppliers of pharmaceutical products, negotiate contracts and terms, and maintain strong relationships to ensure competitive pricing and timely delivery. Purchase Management:  Oversee the entire purchase process, from identifying purchasing needs to placing orders, tracking shipments, and verifying receipt of goods. Inventory Management:  Monitor inventory levels, forecast demand, and optimize inventory turnover to minimize stockouts and excess inventory. Cost Control:  Analyze purchasing trends, identify cost-saving opportunities, negotiate discounts, rebates, and incentives with suppliers, and implement cost reduction initiatives. Quality Assurance:  Ensure that all purchased pharmaceutical products meet regulatory requirements, quality standards, and specifications. Margin Enhancement:  Identify opportunities to increase margins through strategic purchasing decisions, negotiating extra margins with suppliers, and optimizing product mix. Range Expansion:  Collaborate with the sales and marketing teams to identify new product opportunities, expand product range, and enhance product offerings to meet customer demands. Compliance:  Ensure compliance with company policies, procurement regulations, and industry standards in all purchasing activities. Qualifications and Skills: Bachelor's degree in B.Pharm/Business Administration, Supply Chain Management, or related field. Master's degree preferred. Minimum of 1 years of experience in procurement, preferably in the OTC Products/FMCG/healthcare industry, preferably from Pharma distribution background Strong knowledge of OTC Brands and various SKUs Knowledge of regulatory requirements and quality standards in pharmaceutical procurement. Ability to work independently, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment. If your profile matches the requirement, please send your resume to subinp.kurian@enterohealthcare.com   Subin P Kurian HRBP South 2 Entero Healthcare Solutions Ltd E-Mail: subinp.kurian@enterohealthcare.com

column2: Purchasing Executive-Conrad Bengaluru        (      Job Number:          HOT0AHYA    )          Work Locations      :          Conrad Bengaluru            25/3,  Kensington Rd,  Halasuru,  Someshwarpura                    Bengaluru        560008                    With thousands of hotels in over 100 countries and territories,  Hilton offers countless opportunities to delight.  From an open door to a welcoming smile and an exceptional experience,  we offer the millions of travellers who stay with us every year a welcome they will never forget.  In addition to our flagship brand,  Hilton Hotels & Resorts,  the family of brands includes Waldorf Astoria,  LXR,  Conrad,  Canopy,  Curio Collection,  DoubleTree,  Hilton Garden Inn,  Hampton and many others.      If you appreciate the impact global travel can have on the world,  you may be just the person we are looking for to work as a Hilton Team Member.  Because it s with Hilton where we never forget the reason we're here: to delight our guests,  Team Members,  and owners alike.          The core responsibilities of the Purchasing Executive are to assist the Purchasing Manager to ensure the smooth and efficient operation of the Purchasing department and to procure the items required by the Management at a competitive price but without compromising quality.            What will I be doing?      As the Purchasing Executive,  you will be responsible for performing the following tasks to the highest standards:       Follow up on hotel purchasing policy and procedures when carrying out of all purchases.        Obtain three competitive quotes from suppliers to minimize cost to hotel.        Conduct interviews with suppliers and representatives,  obtain information,  specifications,  quotations on items required and handle subsequent correspondence and negotiations for procurement.        Place orders with suppliers and ensure timely delivery to satisfy hotel requirement and trace the outstanding orders to ensure operational needs are met.        Check pricing of purchase orders and determining appropriate supplier to obtain best quality and price.        Conduct market survey to understand the market trend and the price floating.        Safeguard the petty cash float (if any) to ensure no unauthorized access the float.        Collect the Market List quotation at regular intervals.        Regularly review contract supplies to ensure prices remain competitive,  maintaining competitor knowledge of similar products by regularly surveying price lists of other hotels operation supplies.        Analyze market trends to anticipate likely price fluctuations for the purpose of maintaining inventory either for long or short time periods.        Ensure all documentation (purchase orders,  invoices,  delivery dockets,  etc. ) are forwarded to Accounts Payable on a timely basis.        Minimize the risks of accidents and workers compensation costs by ensuring the correct work practices are used and that the area is safe from hazards.        Handle all requests and enquiries in a timely,  efficient and friendly manner.        Perform any additional tasks assigned to ensure that the department functions smoothly.        Strictly follow the code of conduct.                        What are we looking for?       A Purchasing Executive serving Hilton Brands is always working on behalf of our Guests and working with other Team Members.  To successfully fill this role,  you should maintain the attitude,  behaviours,  skills,  and values that follow:       College graduate.        At least 2 years of working experience as Purchasing Associate.        Proficient in Microsoft Office applications.        Able to lead,  provide guidance and develop team members.        Knowledgeable of supplies.        Mature and reliable person.        Good command of both written and spoken English to meet business needs.        Prior experience in related work preferred.        Able to be resourceful,  creative and maintain flexibility.        Flexible in relation to work hours.            What will it be like to work for Hilton?       Hilton is the leading global hospitality company,  spanning the lodging sector from luxurious full-service hotels and resorts to extended-stay suites and mid-priced hotels.  For nearly a century,  Hilton has offered business and leisure travellers the finest in accommodations,  service,  amenities and value.  Hilton is dedicated to continuing its tradition of providing exceptional guest experiences across its global brands.  Our vision to fill the earth with the light and warmth of hospitality unites us as a team to create remarkable hospitality experiences around the world every day.  And,  our amazing Team Members are at the heart of it all!                     Job      :        Supply Management,  Procurement,  Purchasing,  and Receiving          Schedule      :        Full-time

column2: Control Tower Executive Supply Chain    Control Tower Executive Supply Chain    Job Description:    Control Tower Supply Chain is a central (Pan India) monitoring unit functioning within the supply chain division of Jumbotail and will be located in Bangalore.    As Control Tower Executive Supply Chain you will be responsible for complete oversight of supply chain operations across different legs First Mile ,  Line Haul Logistics ,  Fulfilment Centre and Last Mile deliveries ,  Professionals in this role not only need to ensure smooth and timely functioning of supply chain across various locations but also need to help in providing un - parallel delivery experience to the customers    In the First Mile:     Support the First Mile team by providing visibility and insights by    setting up process adherence checks and publishing metrics to first mile team    first - mile pick sheet generation based on capacity available and inventory position.    Co - ordinate and follow - up on returns to sellers / vendors ensuring items are received in the right quantity and quality.    Co - ordinate for all exceptions with biz ops and FC Ops and resolve them on regular basis.     This team will also track manpower and vehicle fleet performance in First Mile In the Fulfillment Center:     Work with Biz Ops for ensuring ASN compliance and ASN adherence     Build checks in inward process ,  ensure all inwards are done within SLA and accurately     Track put - away process and ensure timely in - stock of goods. Supervise cycle counting and inventory correction activity.    Track and publish productivity report for inward ,  put away ,  picking ,  dispatch executives.    Conduct complete RCA on fill rate issues and publish reports     Track expired and slow - moving stock with the help of ground operations.     Follow - up with business team to ensure timely liquidation and return vendor     Track manpower and vehicle fleet performance in First Mile In the Last Mile:     Ensure process adherence and follow - up with ground team to provide an unparalleled delivery experience to customers.    first level escalation in case of any process failures. Ensure the performance is met and    provide support and guidance in case of any lag. on performance for different locations -  DCs.     Co - ordinate with KAM / VAM / CD / FC / FM and resolve customer escalations.     Responsible for Last mile planning and routes planning across Distribution Centres using route planning software.    follow up on  ,  returns ,  re - attempts ,  return pickups ,  goods replacement and damages exceptions     Ensure on - time manpower reporting and vehicle reporting. Work with capacity team to ensure adhoc requests are met to safeguard customer interest.    vehicle capacity planning ,  raising requests for ad - hoc capacity when needed across first mile ,  last mile and line haul.     Work with on - boarded vendors to resolve all driver related issues faced on the ground     Overview timely reporting and SLA adherence by all vehicles. Ensure complete reconciliation of logistics MIS.    daily report on vehicle reporting time ,  vehicle capacity and time utilization    Requirements: We are looking for leaders at all levels who have the hunger to work with some of the smartest people ,  who are driven by a sense of purpose ,  and who wish to leave a legacy in their respective domains and among their professional fraternity. We are not just building apps or tech platforms ,  but rather building distributed ecosystems connected through intelligent technology that can change the face of the food and grocery consumption pipelines in India ,  forever ,  for the better.    An ideal candidate for this role is someone who has -      Graduate from a well - known university ( Under - graduate with decent work experience can also apply)     Ability to perform multiple tasks ,  adjust quickly in short time frame with limited direct supervision     Ability to create rapport with others and build a team environment     Ability to work flexible hours if necessary (all shifts)     Strong written and verbal communication ,  organizational ,  motivational and time management skills     Excellent Facilitation skills     Should be well versed with Excel ,  power point presentation Basic Knowledge of SQL     Prior working knowledge in Analytics using Analytic tools will be an added advantage We would like to hear from candidates who have the hunger to impact real lives and who can match our high bar on that we live by. If you -      can apply first principles thinking to solve problems     can envision a great future that you want to create     have the fire in your belly to get out of your cube and do something about your vision and passion     want to work with some really smart people ,  and still raise the bar for all of us     can have fun and help your colleagues have fun doing all of the above.. we would love to hear from you

column2: Role & responsibilities     Job Description  Purchase & Inventory Management  1. New vendor development & and sustaining long-term relationships with suppliers, coordination with QA/QC/R&D for product/internal approval. Inventory Control through aging and coordinate with the production plant for FG and PM management. 2. Floating RFQ to vendors, preparation of price comparison for approval, Negotiations, Final approval from Dept. Head, making purchase orders in the system & and sending the PO to suppliers.      3. Arranging advance payment to vendor wherever applicable, Coordination with logistics for vehicle arrangement for material pick-up wherever applicable, Follow-up, tracking of materials & and ensuring that material should reach as per given schedule.  4. Ensuring the replacement/rejection of faulty material, CAPA Reports, etc. Coordination with stores & and accounts team for timely entry of materials receipt in the system for bills Booking, Checking and forwarding vendors bills to accounts for booking, Help accounts department in reconciliation of accounts statements and balance confirmations.  6. Co-ordination with internal finance/accounts for credit notes, debit notes etc. wherever applicable, Co-ordination with supplier for credit notes, debit notes, queries etc. wherever applicable  7. Review Minimum Order Quantity (MQQ) and Minimum Inventory Level (MIL) as per consumptions.  8. Coordination with internal Dept. Logistics/Plant/Stores/QA/QC/R&D/Marketing/Sales/ Accounts/Finance for smooth transaction of business. 9. Tracking of prices month on month basis to understand the market changes.  10. Documentation & filing as per ISO standards, assuring compliance with stipulated SOPs.  11. Other activities and responsibilities as assigned by Seniors time to time. Preferred candidate profile     Bachelor's degree in BCom, Engineering, logistics, MBA in Supply Chain Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Interpersonal skill Proficiency in using MS Office, SAP, TALLY 3-4 years of  experience in Purchase & Procurement knowledge, Negotiation skills,  Organizational and Time management Perks and benefits   As per company Norms

column2: Role & responsibilities     1) Receipt of proper PR (Purchase requisition) with correct and relevant details like MAKE / MODEL / SIZE / UNITS / USER etc., checking with stores for current stock & getting approval from FM & GM. 2) Checking the last supply price with vendor details & highlighting if any discrepancies observed.  3) Receipt of identified sample from Production / garage, marking it, safe storage / use of the same in line with Purchase Requests & also simultaneous floating / sending /and immediate follow-up by calling up vendors to quote properly. 4) Floating the inquiries to the Approved / competing vendors & obtaining correct quotes, studying it, preparing the comparative statement on basis of MAKE / PRICE / AVAILABILITY / SUITABILITY etc., wherever essential and submitting to Purchase Head for finalization. 5) Maintaining the vendor database i.e., Name of Company / Contact details of the salesperson / location of their office / warehouse / service center, details for normal / warranty repairs etc., as per ISO. 6) Processing / Print out and later filing of all system generated purchase orders with back-up papers, for local & import orders after the approval of Finance Manager & General Manager. 7) Checking the correct price/ quantity / currency / payment terms /  Discount / delivery mode & period AND MOST IMPORTANT Payment Terms while preparing LPOs. 8) Timely Expediting and follow-up for supply & delivery, to avoid delays. 9) Arranging / coordinating proper pick up of ordered goods from Market. 10) Coordinating and follow-up of outside repair works for critical items i.e., arranging for collection & receiving the quote & obtaining the necessary approval from Purchase Manager / Finance Manager / General Manager. 11) Preparing & maintaining the CASH purchase details for record & reimbursement. 12) Avoid cash purchases and if necessary, should be purchased only after authorization by Manager  Purchase  / Finance Manager 13) Preparation of necessary documents for sending the goods / tools etc., for overseas repairs. REPORTS Every 2nd of each month, present reports for the previous month for the following:- 1. Pending Requisitions pending since more than 10 days 2. The number of Vendors developed over the month and for which area / items.

Purchases orders: prepare and process purchase orders, ensuring accuracy and timely delivery of goods. 5. Inventory management: Monitor inventory levels and track deliveries to ensure adequate stock levels are maintained. 6. Quality Control: Ensure purchased products meet quality standards and specifications. 7.Documentations: Maintain accurate records of purchase, pricing, and inventory.  8. column2: About the role:  A Purchase Executive is responsible for executing the company's procurement activities, ensuring cost-effectiveness, quality, and timely delivery of goods and services. Responsibilities: Research & select potential vendors.  Compare and evaluate offers from suppliers.  Negotiate contract terms of agreement and pricing Track orders and ensure timely delivery.  Review quality of purchased products. Enter order details (e.g. vendors, quantities, prices) into internal databases.  Maintain updated records of purchased products, delivery information and invoices.  Prepare reports on purchases, including cost analyses and ensuring compliance with company policies and procedures. Monitor stock levels and place orders as needed.  Coordinate with warehouse staff to ensure proper storage.  Stay up-to-date with industry trends.  Requirements:  Proven work experience of 2-3 years as a purchasing Officer, purchasing agent or similar role  Good knowledge of vendor sourcing practices (researching, evaluating and liaising with vendors) Understanding of supply chain procedures  Solid analytical skills, with the ability to create financial reports and conduct cost analyses  Excellent Negotiation and communication skills  Vendor relationship management Ability to work independently and as a part of team Excellent organizational and problem solving skills Flexible in relation to work hours.  Qualifications: Any Graduate, Diploma in Civil Proficient in Microsoft Office applications  Construction, real estate, civil site and Interior Experience will be preferred

column2: Role & responsibilities     Job Description: Purchase Executive (Import & Export) in the Jewelry Industry As a Purchase Executive specializing in Import & Export within the Jewelry Industry, your primary responsibility will be to manage the procurement and sourcing activities of jewelry products, raw materials, and accessories from both domestic and international markets. You will play a crucial role in ensuring that the company's inventory is well-stocked with high-quality jewelry products, and that all import and export processes are in compliance with relevant regulations. Responsibilities: Sourcing and Procurement:  Identify potential suppliers and manufacturers both domestically and internationally to source high-quality jewelry products, raw materials, and accessories. Conduct thorough market research to identify trends, new products, and cost-effective sources. Negotiation and Contracting:  Develop and maintain strong relationships with suppliers and negotiate pricing, terms, and conditions. Ensure all contractual obligations are met, including obtaining required documents and certifications. Import and Export Compliance:  Oversee the import and export processes, ensuring compliance with local and international trade regulations, customs requirements, and documentation procedures. Coordinate with shipping agencies, customs authorities, and logistics personnel to ensure smooth and timely delivery of goods. Inventory Management:  Collaborate with the inventory and sales teams to forecast demand, plan procurement activities, and maintain optimum stock levels. Monitor inventory levels and implement strategies to reduce costs and minimize excess inventory. Quality Assurance:  Conduct regular quality inspections and audits to ensure that all jewelry products, raw materials, and accessories meet the company's quality standards. Collaborate with the quality assurance department to resolve any quality-related issues. Supplier Relationship Management:  Build and maintain strong relationships with suppliers, ensuring consistent product quality, on-time delivery, and favorable pricing. Conduct regular supplier evaluation and performance reviews to foster long-term partnerships. Preferred candidate profile     Proven experience as a Purchase Executive or similar role within the jewelry industry, with a focus on import and export activities. Strong negotiation, communication, and interpersonal skills. Proficient in supplier sourcing, evaluation, and contract negotiation. Familiarity with inventory management and procurement software systems. Attention to detail and ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously.   We need candidate who comfortable with Sewri and Ghansoli both location. Currently we are located in Sewri location but after sometime we will shift to Ghansoli location Interested candidates can Call or WhatsApp - 8591992798

column2: Designation- Procurement Executive We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Procurement Executive to develop and implement innovative procurement strategies within our organization. The successful candidate will be responsible for creating cost-effective solutions that address the growing complexities and challenges within the industry. You will play a crucial role in reviewing contract specifications, ensuring supplier compliance, identifying new vendors, and managing project-specific procurement activities. Additionally, you will be expected to maintain records, coordinate with internal departments, negotiate with vendors, and stay updated on changing industry trends. Experience- 3+ years of experience in the relevant / Design & Build Industry. Responsibilities: Develop and implement regional procurement strategies that are innovative, cost-effective, and aligned with organizational goals. Review contract specifications on behalf of the company, ensuring clarity and accuracy. Ensure suppliers deliver goods or services in accordance with contractual obligations and quality standards. Identify new vendors and generate competition to optimize the supplier base. Evaluate and compare vendors based on performance, pricing, quality, and other relevant criteria. Follow up on procurement activities for various projects, tracking all purchase orders raised and ensuring rigorous delivery follow-ups. Maintain project-wise procurement records and documentation for reference and auditing purposes. Track dispatch and follow-up for payments, ensuring timely and accurate documentation and file management. Develop and nurture vendor relationships, resolving any issues or disputes that may arise. Collaborate with internal departments, such as projects and finance, to ensure smooth coordination and execution of procurement activities. Negotiate with vendors to obtain the best offers, terms, and conditions for the company. Coordinate with suppliers, technical teams, account sections, and site teams to ensure efficient work execution. Focus on lowering lead time, ensuring on-time delivery, and assuring the quality of transport services and vendor performance. Stay updated on changing industry trends, market conditions, and best practices in procurement and supply chain management. Requirements: Proven 2+ years of experience in procurement within the Interior industry. Knowledge of technical specifications and commercials of interior materials & MEP items. Strong knowledge of sourcing strategies, Tendering, Contracts, and vendor management. Excellent negotiation and contract management skills. Proficient in budgeting and cost control. Ability to evaluate supplier performance and manage inventory. Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities. Knowledge of procurement regulations and compliance. Strong communication and relationship-building skills. Detail-oriented and able to work in a fast-paced environment.
column11: Material Procurement, Vendor Development, Procurement Planning, Procurement Management

Regular site visits. - Creating strong networking within and outside the organization. - Continuous monitoring, review & taking timely corrective action to achieve the targets. 5) Expert in construction material Handle end to end procurement of the assigned material and ensure timely delivery of materials at sites and timely payment to suppliers. 6) Enhance value of the product / services and make annual rate contracts obtain alternate products / vendors or substituting the OEM's. 7) He should have Good negotiation skills / presentation skill for effective coordination with all sites. 8) Control Inventory by optimizing lot size and reducing delivery lead time. 8) Collecting quotations from various vendors against purchase requisition. 9) Making a comparison of received quotations for rate quality etc for analysis and finalization. 10) Ensure materials purchased are according with company requirement. 11) Assist in daily operational purchasing needs such as planning, issuing and following up on Purchase Orders delivery and shipment schedules. 12) Assist in evaluate supplier performance based on quality standards, delivery time & best prices and ensure all the criteria are met according to the organizational requirements and expectation. 13) Continuous monitoring, review & taking timely corrective action to achieve the targets Preferred candidate profile     Candidate must possess at least Diploma/Advanced/Higher/Graduate Diploma in Business Studies/Administration/Management or equivalent. Minimum 7-8 years experience in Material Purchase in a Real Estate Company Experience in real estate would be preferred. Age Group = 31 yrs to 45 yrs. Experience in real estate is highly preferred. Driving of 2 wheeler mandatory for male candidates. Proficient in English will be give an extra efficient. Able to work in a team as well as independently. Computer literate, with knowledge in Microsoft Office. A team player with excellent interpersonal and analytical skills, creative and resourceful. Initiative and possesses drive, work well under pressure to meet fast changing requirements and expectations Proven negotiation and facilitation skills Analytical, data driven approach with an attention to detail. Perks and benefits   Salary = 20000 to 30000 per month

column2: About Us: At Phillips Machine Tools, we are ready to help. We offer Productivity Solutions on every front. Affordable, innovative services for building better SKILLS, better PROCESSES, and better PERFORMING MACHINES. We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Technical Purchase Executive to join our team. If you are passionate about technology procurement and have a track record of driving efficiency and cost savings, we want to hear from you. Job Description: As a Technical Purchase Executive, you will be the driving force behind our technology procurement efforts. You will leverage your technical expertise to ensure we acquire solutions at the best value. You will play a pivotal role in shaping our technology infrastructure. Key Responsibilities: Procurement Strategy: Evaluate and select suppliers of technical products and services, considering quality, cost, and reliability. Lead negotiations with suppliers to secure favorable terms, pricing, and contracts. Collaborate closely with technical teams to understand their needs and develop effective procurement strategies. Market Intelligence: Continuously monitor market trends, product advancements, and pricing fluctuations to inform purchasing decisions. Procurement Execution: Oversee the end-to-end procurement process, from vendor selection to delivery, ensuring timely and cost-effective execution. Establish and cultivate strong supplier relationships to ensure dependable supply chains and quality assurance. Implement cost-saving initiatives without compromising product quality. Maintain precise procurement records, ensuring compliance with company policies and industry regulations. Maintain a database of approved suppliers, evaluate offers, and negotiate the best pricing. Create contracts with vendors to optimize terms and agreements. Monitor purchase requests, open purchase orders, lead times, and deliveries. Efficiently manage inventory through demand planning for sourcing and distribution of required parts and accessories. Proficient in warehouse processes, receiving, storage, and inventory management. Maintain accurate records of purchase requisition forms. Follow up with vendors to ensure timely delivery and track vendor payments. Verify all purchased or received parts against supplier invoices, checking for correct quantity and quality. Take responsibility for regularizing any transactions that deviate from the inventory management system due to specific business requirements as soon as possible. Reporting and Compliance: Generate MIS reports for open purchase orders, lead times, pricing, and purchase product quality. Stay updated on relevant laws and regulations governing technical procurement. Continuous Improvement: Maintain a commitment to self-improvement, constantly seeking opportunities to enhance skills and knowledge. Conduct supplier performance assessments and initiate corrective actions as needed to ensure optimal supplier relationships. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in a technical field, engineering, or business. Proven track record in technical procurement, preferably within a technology-intensive industry. Strong negotiation skills and technical acumen. Proficiency in procurement software and tools. Analytical mindset with the ability to make data-driven decisions. Exceptional problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Self-motivated with the ability to work independently and collaboratively. Familiarity with relevant procurement regulations and best practices. Excellent communication skills to build and maintain supplier relationships. Certification in procurement or supply chain management is a plus. Benefits: Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses Comprehensive health insurance Continuous professional development opportunities Innovative and inclusive work environment Opportunity to work with technology If you're a proactive and technically savvy individual who thrives in a fast-paced environment, we encourage you to apply for this exciting role. Please submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your relevant experience and how it aligns with our requirements. Interested candidates can share their resumes on  dchitare@phillipscorp.com Regards  Divya Chitare

column2: Job Title:  Buying /Sourcing Executive Location:  Pune Vishrantwadi Salary:   5,00,000 - 8,00,000 Job Type:  Full Time, Permanent Work Timing:  7:30 am to 4:00 pm IST  About Us Based in central Bradford, we are a leading manufacturer of innovative own brand, products designed to challenge the market. With over 25 years in the business, we now have four dedicated office spaces including a production office in China and support in India. Now, we are gearing up to shake the electronic and health and beauty industries to their core with the introduction of two new brands and a multitude of different and exciting products, and that is just the beginning. We are innovative, driven, and fearless. If you are a Buying/Sourcing specialist, a real people person and committed to making difference, we want to hear from you. Main Responsibilities: Sourcing Suppliers and maintaining long-lasting relationships with them as well as existing suppliers. Implementing inventory optimization strategies within the company. Work closely with the Head buyer. Obtaining quotes from different suppliers. Negotiating price, quantity, and delivery schedules with suppliers. Working with legal counsel to ensure that all contracts relating to product procurement contain all details of the negotiation. Generating quote comparisons and contributing to internal supplier selection based on the quotes. Providing solutions to improve company spending and outsourcing. To source and organize the transportation and shipping at competitive prices & fast shipping terms; make sure deadlines & delivery dates are met; Gather and manage all information regarding pricing, correspondence, technical specifications, quality, and legal issues: from start to end. Create & follow up purchase orders, control, and update the weekly stock list to the manager. Other work as assigned by the head buyer. Requirement: Bachelor's degree in Administration, Logistics, Supply Chain, or related field. Proven experience in sourcing processes. A thorough understanding of sourcing methodologies. Strong negotiation skills. Sound time-management and organizational skills. Experience from LED, FMCG, Medical supply, industries preferred Mandarin speaker will be an added advantage

column2: Job Title: Purchase Executive Company:  Interface Digital Solution Pvt.Ltd. Job Description: 1. Supplier Management:  Identify and evaluate potential suppliers, including conducting supplier assessments and negotiating contracts and terms.  Build and maintain strong relationships with suppliers to ensure competitive pricing, quality products, and reliable delivery.  Monitor supplier performance and address any issues or concerns, such as late deliveries or quality discrepancies. 2. Procurement Process:  Develop and implement procurement strategies to meet the organization's needs while optimizing costs and minimizing risks.  Generate purchase orders based on approved requisitions and ensure timely processing and approval.  Coordinate with internal stakeholders, such as department heads, to understand their requirements and preferences. 3. Negotiation and Cost Management:  Negotiate favorable terms and pricing with suppliers to achieve cost savings and maximize value for the organization.  Analyse price proposals, financial reports, and other data to assess the competitiveness of offers and make informed decisions.  Implement cost-saving initiatives, such as bulk purchasing, vendor consolidation, and alternative sourcing. 4. Inventory Control:  Monitor inventory levels and forecast demand to ensure adequate stock levels while minimizing excess inventory and carrying costs.  Coordinate with warehouse and logistics teams to manage inventory replenishment and optimize storage space utilization.  Conduct periodic inventory audits and reconcile discrepancies to maintain accuracy in inventory records. 5. Compliance and Documentation:  Ensure compliance with procurement policies, procedures, and regulatory requirements.  Maintain accurate records of procurement transactions, including purchase orders, contracts, and supplier agreements.  Collaborate with legal and finance teams to review and finalize contracts and agreements as needed.

column2: Responsibilities: Lead the end-to-end procurement process for IT hardware, software, and services, including vendor selection, negotiation, and contract management. Build and maintain strong relationships with OEM partners and third-party vendors to ensure timely delivery, quality products, and competitive pricing. Strategic Sourcing: Identify cost-saving opportunities and alternative sourcing strategies to optimize procurement processes and achieve cost efficiencies. Contract Negotiation: Negotiate favorable terms and conditions with vendors, including pricing, delivery schedules, and service level agreements (SLAs). Ensure compliance with company policies, industry regulations, and legal requirements throughout the procurement process. Identify and mitigate potential risks associated with vendor relationships. Collaborate with internal stakeholders, including IT teams, finance, and business units, to understand their requirements and align procurement activities with organizational goals. Develop and manage procurement budgets, forecast expenditures, and track costs to ensure adherence to financial targets and objectives. Stay abreast of industry trends, market developments, and emerging technologies to drive innovation and improvement in procurement processes and practices. Qualifications: Bachelors degree in business administration, Supply Chain Management, or related field. 2-4 years of experience in IT procurement, vendor management, and enterprise-level IT infrastructure and solution services. Proven track record of successfully managing procurement projects, negotiating contracts, and driving cost-saving initiatives. Strong understanding of IT hardware, software, and services, with knowledge of leading OEM partners and industry best practices. Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build and maintain effective relationships with internal and external stakeholders. Analytical mindset with proficiency in data analysis, financial modeling, and procurement tools/software. Ability to work independently, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced and dynamic environment. Relevant certifications in procurement, supply chain management, or ITIL are a plus.

column2: and machineryExecutivePosition:  Purchase - Executive Experience:  7+ Years Qualification:  Any Location:  Pune (HO) Notice Period:  Immediate, Serving or 30 Days #Contact Person: Chandan Raj Pandit HR (Head Office, Pune) Share your resume at talentacquisition@rohanbuilders.com Please Note that Candidates with Residential experience are preferable   Key Responsibilities   1) Review of PRs (Purchase Request) to Preparing PO (Purchase Order) - Review all PRs and ensure the PR is complete in all aspects (specifications, requirements, time   of delivery, etc.) - Float inquiries to get competitive quotations & prepare the comparative cost statements - Prepare POs take signatures of authorized signatories, scan and send PO to vendors. - Ensure that the vendor acknowledges receipt of the PO and provide an estimated delivery date. 2) Vendor Management - Keep exploring vendors in new markets / new type of materials, alternative vendors in existing markets for competitive purchasing - Maintain a vendor database as per the company standards - Keep meeting the vendors to maintain good relationships all the time, negotiate on rates / T&C when found necessary, and resolve issues/complaints if any. - Verify all vendor bills and supporting documents.  - Coordinate with vendors for any quality issues that may arise after the delivery of materials at the site. 3) Logistics Usage of Company Commercial Vehicle for material movement - Discuss with the project team regarding the movement of materials (inter-site transfers) - Review with the team at the end of each day for assigning company vehicles for the next day depending on requirements at each site. - Maintenance - timely servicing & repairs, insurance renewal, fitness certificates. 4) Materials and Inventory Management  - Coordinate with vendors and ensure material is delivered at site as per the delivery schedule. - Ensure minimum inventory levels of selected materials are maintained as per standard set by the organization. - Review the store's report on a daily basis, coordinate with the stores team to check materials received at the site and if any delays in deliveries - Review open POs twice a week and follow up with vendors on delivery schedule of materials. 5) Planning and Review Meeting - Participate in project meetings that involve discussion on material procurement. - Understand the materials required at the site and plan procurement accordingly. 6) MIS / Report Preparation - Prepare reports as required by the HOD. Like Reconciliation statements, Materials Warranty Statement - Ensure the data for such MIS reports are derived from ERP (High Rise) only, which provides accuracy and reliability of data. - Submit all reports on a timely basis.   7) Plant & Machinery Repair and replacement of machine parts - Understand which part has been damaged, and check with the concerned members if the part can be repaired or need to be replaced.  - Provide inputs to the manager about which is a better option in the repair and replacement of machine parts - Find a reliable and good vendor, coordinate with the P&M team, to repair the machine parts. - Ensure we get the repaired / replacement parts in time, as this is very critical to our operations.     Key Deliverables / Performance Measures  Prepare PO with accurate details. Maintain accuracy while entering data. Reduction in Material Cost (compared to a previous purchase) Materials Dispatch Lead Time (Agreed / Planned vs. Actual) Nil Loss on account of Non-Moving Materials  Inventory Management (Within agreed value, following FIFO, etc.)   Key Challenges   Ensure minimal mistakes while entering data in the system. Ensure materials are delivered as per the agreed delivery schedule. Working with timeline Commitment.   Ideal Candidate For The Role: Knowledge Materials Knowledge (Construction) ERP Knowledge (Materials Management) Computer Operating Knowledge (XL is critical) Basics of Purchasing Process Materials Availability (Geographical Spread & Advantages) Linguistic Ability (Proficiency in Multiple Languages) Basic Construction Work (stage by stage Process) Skill Basic Mathematics (Formulas, conversion metrics, etc.) Negotiation Written Communication (Correspondence) Data Entry Vendor Relationship Management

column2: Position: Sourcing Executive Job location: Desmania, IMT Manesar, Gurgaon Experience: 3-5 years of Industry experience Desmania is seeking a skilled and dynamic Sourcing Executive to join its team. As a Sourcing Executive, you will play a critical role in identifying, evaluating, and engaging with potential suppliers and vendors to procure goods and services necessary for the company's operations. Your expertise in sourcing and procurement will be essential in ensuring the best value, quality, and reliability for the organization. JOB PROFILE: 1.Identify and evaluate potential suppliers based on capabilities, product quality, and financial stability. 2.Develop sourcing strategies by analysing market trends and pricing to optimize procurement decisions. 3.Manage the Request for Proposal (RFP) process and negotiate favourable deals with suppliers. 4.Handle contract negotiation, ensuring compliance and monitoring supplier performance. 5.Build strong relationships with suppliers and conduct regular performance reviews. 6.Identify cost-saving opportunities and improve sourcing processes for efficiency. 7.Promote supplier diversity and sustainable sourcing practices. 8.Analyse data, track performance, and provide regular reports to management. SKILL SETS: 1.Bachelors degree in business, Supply Chain Management, or a related field. 2.Proven experience in sourcing, procurement, or supply chain management. 3.Strong negotiation, communication, and interpersonal skills. 4.Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities. 5.Knowledge of supplier management principles and best practices. 6.Familiarity with procurement software and tools is a plus. 7.Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment. 8.Demonstrated commitment to ethical sourcing and sustainability.

column2: Gegadyne Energy, an innovative company dedicated to accelerating the worlds transition to an all-electric economy, is seeking a Procurement Executive to join their team. The ideal candidate will have a passion for challenging the status quo and making a difference in the world of energy storage and material science. As a Procurement Executive, youll play a key role in supporting the companys mission to develop non-lithium-based quick charging battery technology. Gegadyne Energy is on a mission to revolutionize battery technology and change the unit economics of everything related to energy storage and material science. This is an excellent opportunity to join a forward-thinking company that is set to change the renewable industry.             Responsibilities           Develop and maintain relationships with suppliers to ensure timely delivery of goods.     o The procurement specialist will need to work closely with suppliers to negotiate prices, ensure quality, and manage delivery schedules. They will need to identify and develop new supplier relationships as needed. (P2P, 3-way match, S2P)     Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure procurement strategies align with business objectives.     o The procurement specialist will work closely with Pilot, Operations and R&D assurance teams to ensure that materials availability based on the requests.     Manage the procurement lifecycle from purchase requisition to delivery.     o The procurement specialist will be responsible for monitoring inventory levels of raw materials, parts, and supplies and ensuring that orders are placed in a timely manner to prevent stockouts.     The procurement specialist will need to stay up to date on industry trends, product developments, and supplier capabilities to identify new sourcing opportunities.     Monitor and track supplier performance to ensure adequate levels of service are consistently achieved.     o The procurement specialist will need to negotiate contract terms with suppliers to ensure the best pricing, delivery, and quality.     o Monitoring supplier performance: The procurement specialist will need to monitor supplier performance and resolve any issues related to quality, delivery, or pricing. Develop cost-saving strategies while maintaining quality standards.     Maintain accurate and up-to-date procurement records in compliance with company policies and procedures.     At least 3 to 4 years of experience in procurement in a manufacturing setup.     Minimum 1 year of experience in Import/ Global procurement.     Experience in Chemical/ Pharma/ Aerospace/ ONGC industry is an added advantage.

column2: We are searching for a well-organized purchasing executive to join our growing team. As the purchasing executive, you will carry out all tasks allocated by the purchasing manager, which may include conducting research on potential vendors and suppliers, inspecting goods, and updating records. You should be able to negotiate pricing and transport costs.   To be successful as a purchasing officer you should be able to multitask and evaluate products and vendors. Exceptional purchasing officers should be smooth negotiators with a keen eye for detail.        Purchasing Executive Responsibilities:     - Conducting product research and sourcing new suppliers and vendors.   - Sourcing materials, goods, products, and services and negotiating the best or most cost-effective contracts and deals.   - Performing inventory inspections and reordering supplies and stock as necessary.   - Conducting market research to keep abreast of emerging trends and business opportunities.   - Inspecting stock and reporting any faulty items or inconsistencies immediately.   - Updating and maintaining records of all orders, payments, and receiving the stock.   - Coordinating with the delivery team and following up on delays or orders that have been rescheduled.   - Attending product launches and networking with industry professionals.   - Establishing professional relationships with clients as well as vendors and suppliers.   - Ensuring all stock is packaged appropriately and delivered to the correct location in a timely manner.       Purchasing Executive Requirements:       - Bachelor's degree in business, logistics, or a related field may be required.   - Previous experience of minimum 1 year in a similar position.   - Proficiency in the relevant management software programs.   - Superb written and verbal communication and negotiation skills.   - Great organizational and planning skills.   - The ability to identify market trends and make decisions in a high-stress environment.   - The ability to follow client specifications.   - Excellent networking and time management skills.
