column2: The Purchase Executive is responsible for managing the procurement process, ensuring timely and cost-effective acquisition of goods and services for the organization      They will work closely with vendors, suppliers, and internal stakeholders to assess procurement needs, source suppliers, negotiate contracts, and monitor supplier performance      The Purchase Executive plays a crucial role in maintaining efficient inventory levels and optimizing procurement operations        Key Responsibilities:        Identify procurement needs and requirements by collaborating with internal departments and stakeholders      Research and evaluate potential suppliers based on price, quality, availability, and delivery terms      Negotiate and establish favorable terms and conditions with suppliers, ensuring competitive pricing and favorable contract terms      Prepare and issue purchase orders and contracts to approved suppliers, ensuring accuracy and adherence to organizational policies and procedures      Coordinate with suppliers to ensure timely delivery of goods and services, resolving any issues or delays that may arise      Monitor supplier performance and maintain strong relationships with key suppliers, conducting periodic supplier evaluations and addressing any performance issues      Track and manage inventory levels to optimize procurement activities and ensure adequate stock levels are maintained      Implement cost-saving strategies and initiatives, including vendor consolidation, bulk purchasing, and contract negotiations      Stay updated with market trends, industry regulations, and best practices in procurement to drive continuous improvement      Maintain accurate procurement records, including purchase orders, contracts, supplier information, and pricing details        Qualifications and Skills:        Bachelor's degree in business administration, supply chain management, or a related field      Relevant certifications in procurement or supply chain management are a plus      X years of experience in procurement or purchasing roles, preferably in a similar industry or organization      Strong knowledge of procurement principles, practices, and procedures      Excellent negotiation and communication skills, with the ability to build and maintain strong relationships with suppliers and internal stakeholders      Proficiency in sourcing suppliers, evaluating bids, and negotiating contracts      Familiarity with procurement software and tools to manage procurement processes, such as e-procurement systems or ERP systems      Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with attention to detail      Ability to work independently and prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment      Knowledge of inventory management principles and practices      Familiarity with relevant legal and regulatory requirements related to procurement

column2: The Purchase Executive is responsible for managing the procurement process, ensuring timely and cost-effective acquisition of goods and services for the organization      They will work closely with vendors, suppliers, and internal stakeholders to assess procurement needs, source suppliers, negotiate contracts, and monitor supplier performance      The Purchase Executive plays a crucial role in maintaining efficient inventory levels and optimizing procurement operations        Key Responsibilities:        Identify procurement needs and requirements by collaborating with internal departments and stakeholders      Research and evaluate potential suppliers based on price, quality, availability, and delivery terms      Negotiate and establish favorable terms and conditions with suppliers, ensuring competitive pricing and favorable contract terms      Prepare and issue purchase orders and contracts to approved suppliers, ensuring accuracy and adherence to organizational policies and procedures      Coordinate with suppliers to ensure timely delivery of goods and services, resolving any issues or delays that may arise      Monitor supplier performance and maintain strong relationships with key suppliers, conducting periodic supplier evaluations and addressing any performance issues      Track and manage inventory levels to optimize procurement activities and ensure adequate stock levels are maintained      Implement cost-saving strategies and initiatives, including vendor consolidation, bulk purchasing, and contract negotiations      Stay updated with market trends, industry regulations, and best practices in procurement to drive continuous improvement      Maintain accurate procurement records, including purchase orders, contracts, supplier information, and pricing details      Qualifications and Skills:Bachelor's degree in business administration, supply chain management, or a related field      Relevant certifications in procurement or supply chain management are a plus      X years of experience in procurement or purchasing roles, preferably in a similar industry or organization      Strong knowledge of procurement principles, practices, and procedures      Excellent negotiation and communication skills, with the ability to build and maintain strong relationships with suppliers and internal stakeholders      Proficiency in sourcing suppliers, evaluating bids, and negotiating contracts      Familiarity with procurement software and tools to manage procurement processes, such as e-procurement systems or ERP systems      Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with attention to detail      Ability to work independently and prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment      Knowledge of inventory management principles and practices      Familiarity with relevant legal and regulatory requirements related to procurement

column2: Hello    I hope this email finds you well. We are thrilled to inform you about a rewarding opportunity for the position of Trainee  Purchase /Procurement within our dynamic team.  We are hiring Full time MBA fresher for this position.  Experience - 0-2 years   JOB Details   At  IDEMIA , we are passionate about shaping the future of secure identity and authentication solutions. Our innovative technologies play a crucial role in enhancing security, privacy, and convenience for individuals and organizations worldwide.  You may not know our name, but you have surely used our innovations and solutions. Our mission is to unlock the world and make it safer through cutting-edge identity technologies. Every day, around the globe, we are enabling citizens and consumers alike to perform their daily critical activities (such as pay, connect and travel), in the physical as well as digital space. We are transforming their lives by making the world more secure and yet also more streamlined. We have brought together complementary know-how and technologies that have never been combined before for both the physical and digital era: secured connectivity, secured payments and secured identity management. Cybersecurity, biometrics, large scale distributed systems and Cloud computing, analytics and smart devices are at the core of both our physical products and our software and systems. We serve our clients in 180 countries thanks to our 15,000 employees worldwide.  Purpose This role supports the timely supply of goods and services and brings value to IDEMIA's business and purchasing stakeholders by driving processes and tools efficiency and by providing key insights on purchasing activities, markets, and suppliers Key Missions Performs Procure-to-Pay process activities, such as Purchase Requisitions verifications, Purchase Orders creations, or support to litigations resolution Ensures that the purchasing policy is respected by all Coordinates with Procurement Business Partners to solve any Procure-to-Pay process-related issue Creates, monitors, and maintains all global procurement performance tools and metrics, such as spending and saving reports, supplier scorecards, category dashboards (etc) Gathers supply market data, analyzes trends, and prepares market intelligence reports Ensures compliance of all IDEMIA suppliers by gathering and storing all necessary compliance certificates or proofs Provides the Procurement Business Partners with data or reports for critical IDEMIA suppliers, such as CSR or financial health reports, as agreed and required per regulatory or business needs Analyzes and formalizes Procurement tools maintenance and developments and processes improvements needed for efficient Procurement Tools and Processes Drives maturity of purchasing Tools and Processes, in coordination with IT and internal stakeholders Ensures that relevant maintenance and developments are made, in coordination with IT. Provides necessary support to internal stakeholders, including training, so that purchasing Processes and Tools are understood and well implemented

column2: Skill required:  Procurement Operations - Procurement Support Designation:  Procurement Practice Associate Qualifications: Any Graduation  Years of Experience: 1 to 3 years  What would you do? Go beyond processing purchase orders at lower costs to help clients reap savings and value from the billions they spend on the goods and services that run their day-to-day business operations. You will be working as a part of Procurement management team which uses a systematic approach for buying all the goods and services needed for a company to stay sustainable. They are involved in the identification of need, finding and qualifying the suppliers, requesting proposals, negotiating with suppliers, contracting, delivery and analyzing results.The Procurement Support team focuses on analyzing and designing the best practices for tactical and transactional procurement processes. The team is responsible for planning the implementation based on a detailed understanding of the technologies involved. The role may require for you to provide ongoing maintenance of suppliers, create catalogue content and maintain user authorization data. The team also utilizes procurement applications to provide efficient and effective transactions and maximize compliance. What are we looking for? Procurement Management Written and verbal communication Strong analytical skills Problem-solving skills Commitment to quality  Roles and Responsibilities: In this role you are required to solve routine problems, largely through precedent and referral to general guidelines Your expected interactions are within your own team and direct supervisor You will be provided detailed to moderate level of instruction on daily work tasks and detailed instruction on new assignments The decisions that you make would impact your own work You will be an individual contributor as a part of a team, with a predetermined, focused scope of work Please note that this role may require you to work in rotational shifts Qualification Any Graduation
column11: procurement management, procurement operations, purchase order, procurement, buying, vendor management, strategic sourcing, purchase, buyer activities, new vendor development, purchase management, vendor development, material management, supply chain management

column2: 1. Purchase Requisition Review: Review purchase requisitions or requests from various departments to understand their procurement needs. 2. Supplier Research: Research and identify potential suppliers or vendors who can fulfill the company's requirements. 3. Request for Quotations (RFQs): Prepare and send RFQs to selected suppliers to obtain competitive quotes. 4. Price and Terms Negotiation: Negotiate with suppliers on pricing, terms, and conditions to secure the best deals for the company. 5. Purchase Order Creation: Generate purchase orders based on approved quotes and agreements with suppliers. 6. Order Tracking: Track the status of open purchase orders and follow up with suppliers to ensure timely delivery. 7. Vendor Relationship Management: Maintain positive relationships with suppliers and address any issues or concerns that arise. 8. Inventory Management: Monitor inventory levels and coordinate with suppliers to replenish stock as needed. 9. Quality Assurance: Ensure that purchased goods and services meet quality standards and specifications. 10. Cost Analysis: Conduct cost analysis and comparisons between different suppliers to optimize procurement decisions. 11. Market Research: Stay informed about market trends, pricing, and supplier performance. 12. Budget Management: Adhere to the budget allocated for procurement activities and find cost- effective solutions. 13. Document Management: Maintain accurate and organized records of purchase orders, contracts, and supplier correspondence. 14. Coordination with Internal Teams: Collaborate with various departments to understand their requirements and provide procurement support. 15. Compliance: Ensure compliance with company policies, legal requirements, and ethical procurement practices. 16. Supplier Evaluation: Continuously evaluate supplier performance based on factors like quality, delivery, and responsiveness. 17. Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities to improve procurement processes and implement best practices. 18. Market Intelligence: Keep updated on market trends, new suppliers, and innovative procurement strategies. 19. Vendor Database Management: Create and Maintain vendor database.

quotations to vendors as per the list of components in the material request Ensuring receipt of quotations from the vendors within 7 working days Preparation of comparative statement of cost for all components Elicit appropriate cost of individual components for reference from online sources Arriving at the list of vendors with least cost for components required Negotiating with vendors for further price reduction,  terms of credit and delivery time lines Release of purchase order for supply Receive material from suppliers ensuring all documents such as Delivery Challan,  Invoice,  etc. are in place Ensuring security seal,  finance seal for having received the material and documents along with the package Handing over the package (without opening) and documents to stores for checking for the correctness of supply as per the PO Follow up with Stores to ensure timely acceptance of the components received by arranging for inspection by the indenter Receive back the documents from the stores and pass the same on to accounts department Periodic follow up with vendors for getting quotation against request for quotation Periodic follow up with vendors for getting deliveries as per the accepted delivery period Vendor management in answering questions about payment,  rejected material return and replacement,  etc. Prepare report of payments to be released to vendors based on their agreed payment terms and update the same on a weekly basis and forward to accounts Also raise the payments to be released list with the management,  from time to time,  to ensure vendor satisfaction Material requests received by Excel should be properly stored and archived in soft copy format Weekly data of Material requests should be properly stored and archived in soft copy format Quotation requests sent to vendors should be stored and archived in both hard copy in relevant files and soft copy format Weekly comparative statement to be filed in hard copy and soft copy systematically for easy reference Cross verify Excel sheet containing details of material requests,  receipt of material,  base price of material,  taxes applicable,  customs duty,  if any for correctness of data entered by store keeper Maintain vendor wise files both in hardcopy and softcopy formats

column2: Role & responsibilities   Source and procure mechanical items such as seamless steel pipes, flanges, fittings, structures, and other  related materials. Develop and maintain relationships with suppliers to ensure the timely and cost-effective procurement of  high-quality materials. Evaluate supplier performance and negotiate terms, pricing, and contracts to achieve the best possible deals. Understand and interpret technical specifications to ensure that purchased items meet the required  standards and specifications. Collaborate with the engineering and project management teams to understand their procurement needs  and provide timely solutions. Monitor inventory levels and coordinate with the warehouse team to ensure adequate stock levels without  overstocking. Maintain accurate procurement records and documentation. Stay updated with market trends and new product developments relevant to the industry.   Preferred candidate profile   Bachelors degree in Mechanical Engineering, Supply Chain Management, or a related field. 8-10 years of experience in procurement, with a focus on mechanical items in the gas handling industry. Proven experience in sourcing seamless steel pipes, flanges, fittings, and structures. Strong technical understanding of the products used in the gas handling and energy sectors. Excellent negotiation and communication skills. Strong organizational and analytical skills. Proficiency in procurement software and tools. Experience working in similar companies is a must.

column2: 1.To cross check the data for New Product code creation sent by the user , with existing data of ERP.     2.Check Indent for completion of all related data , Make , Grade vendor ,Asset form if material is Asset ,remark, delivery schedule etc.     3.Based on requirement and availability of material selection of Vendor for procurement of material.     4. Rate Comparison with previous raised orders , cross check with earlier quotation of said vendor for required product.     5. If material is new then take Product details & cross quote from different vendors for the required material.     6. If vendor increases the Rate of existing material, then negotiate prices , once the prices finalized then send the quote for approval of Unit head      7. If material need to be procured from new vendor then collect the samples from the vendor and send for QC approval.     8. If material need to procure from new vendor then after receipt of sample approval , Vendor Evaluation need to be sent to Vendor , accordingly the Vendor will be listed under Approved Supplier list.     9. Once Price approval from Unit Head & Purchase Head the Purchase order will be raised for Indented material.     10. Based on the Quotation agreed payment terms the documentation and follow up with Accounts Departments for Advance Payments to the Vendors.     11. Follow up with vendors for pending orders based on the schedule mentioned on the purchase order.     12. Once the material is received then if part / full quantity of material is rejected then follow up with vendor for supply of rejected /Short supply of material.     13. If Capital Material i.e Assets to be procured then take three different quotes from vendors.     15. Once the Order is raised the copies of Signed purchase orders will be sent to store.     16. Maintain documents as per ISO and other regulatory related documentation such as Vendor Rating ,Approved suppler List etc.     17. Handling of queries from Accounts and other related departments.     18. Report - Monthly Purchase Data need Unit wise.     19. Report Pending Order report.     20. Follow up with the transport agencies when material is to be received from outside state.     21. Filling of Nonconformance of Internal & External Audit .     22. Vendor analysis and reporting to Purchase Head.     23. Internal communication and co-ordination.     24. Co-ordination with related departments.     Requirement     1.Bachelor's Degree in Commerce     2.Fresher or have minimum 1-2 years of experience in Supply chain Management.     3.Knowledge of Market analysis.     4.Ability to show creative and innovative approach towards work.     5.Ability to work under pressure.     6.Should show excellent planning, decision making and time management skills.     7.Ability to handle multiple tasks and work in an organized manner.     8.Should have good communication skills.     9.Should have the ability to train and guide the junior employees.     Experience       Fresher or have minimum 1-2 years of experience

column2: Assistant Purchase Managers provide support to the procurement or purchasing department within an organization      They assist in managing the procurement process, sourcing suppliers, and ensuring the timely acquisition of goods and services needed by the company        Here are the key responsibilities of an Assistant Purchase Manager:        Sourcing Suppliers: Assistant Purchase Managers help identify and evaluate potential suppliers or vendors      They research and compare suppliers based on factors such as price, quality, delivery times, and terms of service      They may also negotiate contracts and establish relationships with suppliers      Purchase Order Processing: They assist in generating purchase orders based on approved requisitions or orders from internal stakeholders      They ensure accuracy and completeness of purchase orders, including the item specifications, quantities, delivery dates, and pricing information      Inventory Management: Assistant Purchase Managers monitor inventory levels and collaborate with relevant departments to determine stock requirements      They maintain accurate records of stock levels, track inventory movement, and coordinate with suppliers to ensure timely replenishment      Supplier Relationship Management: They work closely with suppliers, maintaining effective communication channels and addressing any issues or concerns that may arise      They may participate in supplier performance evaluations, quality audits, and contract negotiations to ensure optimal supplier performance      Price and Contract Negotiation: Assistant Purchase Managers assist in negotiating pricing, terms, and contracts with suppliers to secure favorable agreements for the organization      They may collaborate with senior purchasing managers or procurement officers during negotiations        Vendor Evaluation and Qualification:        They assist in evaluating potential suppliers and conducting due diligence to assess their capabilities, financial stability, reputation, and compliance with industry regulations      They may also maintain a vendor database with relevant information for future reference      Purchase Requisition Processing: They review and process purchase requisitions from different departments, ensuring they comply with company policies and procedures      They may liaise with requestors to gather additional information and clarify requirements, if necessary      Documentation and Reporting: Assistant Purchase Managers maintain accurate records of procurement activities, such as purchase orders, invoices, contracts, and correspondence with suppliers      They generate reports on procurement performance, supplier evaluations, and cost savings for management review      Compliance and Ethics: They adhere to legal and ethical procurement practices, including compliance with applicable laws, regulations, and company policies      They may assist in ensuring supplier compliance with environmental, social, and governance (ESG) standards      Continuous Improvement: Assistant Purchase Managers contribute to the improvement of procurement processes and systems by identifying areas for optimization, cost reduction, and efficiency enhancement      They may propose and implement process improvements to streamline procurement operations      Strong analytical skills, attention to detail, negotiation abilities, and knowledge of procurement processes are essential for success as an Assistant Purchase Manager      Additionally, proficiency in using procurement software or enterprise resource planning (ERP) systems is often required to manage purchasing activities effectively
column11: Procurement, Supplier relationship management, ERP, Purchase requisition, Due diligence, Purchase, Compliance, Cost reduction, Order processing, Continuous improvement

column2: Gegadyne Energy, an innovative company dedicated to accelerating the worlds transition to an all-electric economy, is seeking a Procurement Executive to join their team. The ideal candidate will have a passion for challenging the status quo and making a difference in the world of energy storage and material science. As a Procurement Executive, youll play a key role in supporting the companys mission to develop non-lithium-based quick charging battery technology. Gegadyne Energy is on a mission to revolutionize battery technology and change the unit economics of everything related to energy storage and material science. This is an excellent opportunity to join a forward-thinking company that is set to change the renewable industry.             Responsibilities           Develop and maintain relationships with suppliers to ensure timely delivery of goods.     o The procurement specialist will need to work closely with suppliers to negotiate prices, ensure quality, and manage delivery schedules. They will need to identify and develop new supplier relationships as needed. (P2P, 3-way match, S2P)     Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure procurement strategies align with business objectives.     o The procurement specialist will work closely with Pilot, Operations and R&D assurance teams to ensure that materials availability based on the requests.     Manage the procurement lifecycle from purchase requisition to delivery.     o The procurement specialist will be responsible for monitoring inventory levels of raw materials, parts, and supplies and ensuring that orders are placed in a timely manner to prevent stockouts.     The procurement specialist will need to stay up to date on industry trends, product developments, and supplier capabilities to identify new sourcing opportunities.     Monitor and track supplier performance to ensure adequate levels of service are consistently achieved.     o The procurement specialist will need to negotiate contract terms with suppliers to ensure the best pricing, delivery, and quality.     o Monitoring supplier performance: The procurement specialist will need to monitor supplier performance and resolve any issues related to quality, delivery, or pricing.     The procurement specialist will need to manage procurement systems, including purchase orders, contracts, and supplier databases.     Identify and mitigate supply chain risks.     Develop cost-saving strategies while maintaining quality standards.     Maintain accurate and up-to-date procurement records in compliance with company policies and procedures.     At least 3 to 4 years of experience in procurement in a manufacturing setup.     Minimum 1 year of experience in Import/ Global procurement.     Experience in Chemical/ Pharma/ Aerospace/ ONGC industry is an added advantage.

column2: In this role you will work as Buyer / Estimator / Expeditor Procurement group for global and Indian Projects. You will be expected to        Float enquiries & expedite for offers.          Review technical recommendations issued by engineering group. Prepare commercial bid analysis, review commercial terms & conditions and highlight the issues / problem areas to Lead Engineer. Ensure that there is sufficient back-up data for discussions. Extrapolate the most recent price of materials ordered. Provide internal cost estimate based on facts.          Involve in Techno-commercial negotiations with vendors in the interest of the organization.          Obtain approval from lead engineer for placement of orders, issue orders to vendors & expedite for order acknowledgement.          Co-ordinate with the vendors for the timely documents submission, inspection, delivery of material and also with internal stakeholders. Arrange meetings with vendors, if required.          Identify and highlight the areas of concern which are affecting the project schedule and act as an interface between vendors and internal team to find a solution and resolve the same. In case of ambiguity in related engineering specifications / approved drawings, co-ordinate with the respective engineering department.          Make periodic visits to the vendor s facilities to expedite the delivery.          Expedite for document submission from vendors and co-ordinate with technical disciplines for approval.          Update the Team periodically the delivery status of supplies and ensure that the supplies are as per the schedule and their requirement. Anticipate proactively if there is any delay envisaged from the vendor and inform the Team accordingly.          Estimate for individual items & for the entire equipment list, piping material for proposals, projects and paid studies etc.          Provide feedback on system related issues to star users for dynamic resolution of issues and for better analysis.          Do Day-to-day up-dation & maintenance of vendor and cost database.          Provide feedback on vendor performance with respect to vendor capabilities, adherence to time schedule, resolving issues etc.          Work in a multi-cultural environment with international teams on global projects.              Your profile            Completed university studies as a graduate engineer or comparable master s degreee. column2: A Purchase Executive is responsible for managing the procurement process in an organization. This role involves sourcing and purchasing goods and services that the company requires for its operations. The key responsibilities, skills, and qualifications for a Purchase Executive are outlined below. Responsibilities Sourcing Suppliers Identifying and evaluating potential suppliers and vendors, negotiating terms and prices to secure the best deals. Purchasing Goods and Services Issuing purchase orders, ensuring that the necessary goods and services are procured promptly. Inventory Management Monitoring inventory levels to ensure adequate supplies without overstocking, and coordinating with the inventory team. Budget Management Managing the procurement budget, ensuring cost-effectiveness, and staying within budgetary constraints. Vendor Management Building and maintaining relationships with suppliers, addressing any issues or discrepancies, and ensuring compliance with contracts. Quality Assurance Ensuring that the products and services purchased meet the required quality standards and specifications. Market Research Keeping abreast of market trends, new products, and potential sources of supply. Documentation and Reporting  Maintaining accurate records of purchases, pricing, and inventory, and generating reports as required. Compliance Ensuring that all procurement activities comply with company policies, legal requirements, and ethical standards. Skills and Qualifications Educational Background A bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Supply Chain Management, or a related field is typically required. Additional certifications in procurement or supply chain management can be advantageous. Experience Previous experience in procurement or a related role is often required. Experience in specific industries may also be beneficial. Negotiation Skills Strong negotiation skills to secure favorable terms and pricing from suppliers. Analytical Skills Ability to analyze market trends, supplier performance, and procurement data to make informed decisions. Communication Skills  Excellent verbal and written communication skills for interacting with suppliers, colleagues, and stakeholders. Organizational Skills Strong organizational and time management skills to handle multiple tasks and priorities. Attention to Detail  High attention to detail to ensure accuracy in orders, contracts, and inventory management. Technical Proficiency Proficiency in procurement software, ERP systems, and Microsoft Office Suite. Problem-Solving  Ability to resolve issues related to suppliers, delivery, and product quality effectively. Ethics and Integrity Strong sense of ethics and integrity to ensure fair dealing and compliance with legal and company standards.
column11: Purchase Management, New Vendor Development, Purchase Planning, Material Procurement, Purchase Operations, Purchase Requisition, Purchase Vendor Development, Vendor Negotiation, Procurement Planning, Purchase Order, Vendor Relationship Management, Price Negotiation

column2: Responsibilities: Lead the end-to-end procurement process for IT hardware, software, and services, including vendor selection, negotiation, and contract management. Build and maintain strong relationships with OEM partners and third-party vendors to ensure timely delivery, quality products, and competitive pricing. Strategic Sourcing: Identify cost-saving opportunities and alternative sourcing strategies to optimize procurement processes and achieve cost efficiencies. Contract Negotiation: Negotiate favorable terms and conditions with vendors, including pricing, delivery schedules, and service level agreements (SLAs). Ensure compliance with company policies, industry regulations, and legal requirements throughout the procurement process. Identify and mitigate potential risks associated with vendor relationships. Collaborate with internal stakeholders, including IT teams, finance, and business units, to understand their requirements and align procurement activities with organizational goals. Develop and manage procurement budgets, forecast expenditures, and track costs to ensure adherence to financial targets and objectives. Stay abreast of industry trends, market developments, and emerging technologies to drive innovation and improvement in procurement processes and practices. Qualifications: Bachelors degree in business administration, Supply Chain Management, or related field. 2-4 years of experience in IT procurement, vendor management, and enterprise-level IT infrastructure and solution services. Proven track record of successfully managing procurement projects, negotiating contracts, and driving cost-saving initiatives. Strong understanding of IT hardware, software, and services, with knowledge of leading OEM partners and industry best practices. Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build and maintain effective relationships with internal and external stakeholders. Analytical mindset with proficiency in data analysis, financial modeling, and procurement tools/software. Ability to work independently, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced and dynamic environment. Relevant certifications in procurement, supply chain management, or ITIL are a plus.
column11: IT Procurement, market development, supply chain management, procurement, OEM, vendor relationship, ITIL, financial modeling

column2: C.V. Raman Global University Bhubaneswar - 752 054 (Odisha) https://cgu-odisha.ac.in/faculty-of-agriculture-and-allied-sciences/ Mail us at:  recruitment@cgu-odisha.ac.in ; Contact: +91 9040097244   Job Description for Purchase Officer   Who We Are C.V. Raman Global University (CGU), Odisha started in 1997 as a degree-level engineering college, named as C.V. Raman College of Engineering (CVRCE). With 25 Centres of Excellence set up in collaboration with industry leaders across the board, the university today has over 20 start-ups working under its AIC & TBI incubation centre.  Our Accreditations: Within top 100 Engineering Institutions in India by NIRF (National Institute Ranking Framework), MHRD, and Govt. of India during 2016, 2017, 2018, 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022 & 2023. Recognized as S.I.R.O (Scientific and Industrial Research Organization) by D.S.I.R., Government of India. CGU awarded Skill Champion by Govt. of Odisha in 2023 CGU awarded Higher Education Excellence award by FICCI in 2022 As per Times Engineering Survey (2022), CGU secured a notable position among the top engineering colleges in the country, ranking 35th among the top privately run engineering institutes nationwide and 4th in the eastern region. The University was recognized as a "PERFORMER" in the "University & Deemed to be University (Private/Self-Financed) (Technical)" category in the Atal Ranking of Institutions on Innovation Achievement (ARIIA) 2021, a flagship program of the Ministry of Education, Government of India. Accredited by the NBA (National Board of Accreditation) for UG Courses in Engineering Program.  Notable Awards and Honours: In the field of research, the University received grants over 5 crores in 2022. Ms. Manisha Padhi, alumni of CGU have been appointed as the ADC to The Hon??le Governor of Mizoram in 2023 and became the first ever female to hold the position. Ms. Swagatika Mohanty, Civil Engineering (2013-17), has bagged the 15th rank in Odisha Civil Services Exam in 2023 and is now a functional, respectable, responsible OAS. Safia Aktar, Anshu Kumari, and Radhika Rani Panda won the 1st prize at ??0-Hour Women Hackathon??organised by Trithon Triplets 2k23. Abhishek Kumar, B.Tech (ECE) awarded the Visweswaraya Prativa Puraskar at Odisha Technological Conclave, 2023. Mr. Praveen Giri won the Silver Medal in the area of Water Technology at World Skills, Stuttgart, Germany, 2022. Mr. Subrat Patel won Medallion of Excellence in the area of Restaurant Services at World Skills, Stuttgart, Germany, 2022. 9 students represented India in Worldskills 2022 in 7 various Skills. CGU won Smart India Hackathon (SIH) 2022 in Software Edition. What We Offer Undergraduate Courses: 28 Postgraduate Courses: 33 PhD Programs: 15   The Purchase Department of C.V. Raman Global University is a service department aiming to acquire materials, supplies, equipment, and services at the best possible price and quality. The Purchase Department has the knowledge, experience, and tools to provide the University Community with the necessary information to purchase high-quality goods and services most cost-effectively. Where You Come In We are looking for a highly motivated and detail-oriented Purchase Officer to join our procurement team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in supply chain management, excellent negotiation skills, and a proven track record of managing vendor relationships. This role requires a strategic thinker who can balance cost-efficiency with quality assurance to ensure that our company?? purchasing processes run smoothly and effectively.   Duties & Responsibilities The duties and responsibilities of the position include, but are not restricted to, the following:   Strategic You will be responsible for supporting the the team in preparation of overall procurement strategy, budget and for increasing spend under management, identifying and evolving best practices and transforming the organization from one that is often still locally driven.  Autonomy and adaptability to optimise relations with the various partners (inside and outside) Helping the team in developing SOPs, purchasing policies and procedures for the organisation under the supervision of the reporting authority. Understand and implements short and long-range organizational goals, objectives, strategic plans, policies, and operating procedures; monitors and evaluates programmatic and operational effectiveness, and effects changes required for improvement.   Tactical   Support the team in conducting product research and sourcing new suppliers and vendors. Performing inventory inspections and reordering supplies and stock as necessary Conducting market research to keep abreast of emerging trends and business opportunities Acts as negotiator between the university and vendors/suppliers on procurement contracts; keeps informed of all new developments relative to available resources; makes recommendations designed to reduce costs, update systems, and provide environmentally approved materials and services   Operational Responsibilities   Assist in the selection of appropriate suppliers and contractors, to promote good procurement practice with due regard to sustainability, ethical purchasing standards and costing  Draft an appropriate service level agreement to properly evaluate the performance of suppliers, and report on this on a regular basis.  Work with internal stakeholders (teachers or operations staff) to determine procurement needs quality and delivery requirements.  Responsible for order placement timing, supply / demand alignment, material replenishment and supplier performance   Monitor, evaluate and improve supplier performance, according to an appropriate Service Level Agreement, on a continuous basis Control and monitor expenses against approved budgets  Develop sourcing strategies  Set and plan how to achieve supplier accreditation and service level management  Payment terms negotiation, optimization and management  Maintain contracts with vendors  Review inventory and update as required  Receive orders from various departments  Initiate and keep track of orders  Receive, inspect and distribute orders  Reconcile or resolve order discrepancies with supplies.  Monitor delivery times to ensure they are on time  Maintain good relationships with suppliers and renegotiate prices on a regular basis  Keep daily records  Barcode assets and update asset register  Annual asset stock take  Accounts to be submitted for payment to vendors on time  Administration and reporting as necessary  Make or purchase policy analysis and recommendations  Any other duty as assigned by the reporting authority     Who Are We Looking For  First Class (60%) Throughout career Master?? Degree in Business Administration (MBA) or any relevant degree. At least five years or more relevant experience in Purchase/Procurement.     What We Expect from You as Purchase Officer:  High Professional Standards with sound Analytical Skills which promotes and demonstrates University?? core values of excellence, People Focused, Partnership Working. For more details, visit us at  https://cgu-odisha.ac.in/ .        Want to be a part of our University?  Please write to us and share your updated CV/ Resume at  recruitment@cgu-odisha.ac.in  and apply on  https://recruitment.cgu-odisha.ac.in/.  We eagerly await to hear from you.   Page  1  of  4

column2: Managed Service Providers (MSPs) are always looking for skilled technicians who are responsible for handling back-end infrastructure support as well as advanced second-level support of service requests    in a professional and timely manner and managing the activities and responsibilities of the service desk team     This relates to all technology, including workstations, servers, printers, networks, and vendor-specific hardware and software     As a Procurement Coordinator, your primary responsibility is to support the procurement process and ensure efficient and timely acquisition of goods and services required by the company and its    clients.      You will work closely with the procurement team, internal stakeholders, and external suppliers to facilitate smooth procurement operations.       Education and Qualifications       Bachelors degree in business administration, supply chain management, or a related field (or equivalent experience).     3+ years previous experience in procurement, purchasing, or coordination roles, preferably within an MSP or IT services industry.     Knowledge of procurement principles, best practices, and contract management.     Familiarity with procurement software or enterprise resource planning (ERP) systems, preferably ConnectWise.     Strong attention to detail and excellent organizational skills to manage multiple tasks and priorities effectively.     Effective communication and interpersonal skills to liaise with internal stakeholders and suppliers.     Analytical mindset and problem-solving abilities to analyze data, identify trends, and propose solutions.     Proficiency in MS Office suite, particularly Excel, for data analysis and reporting.         Key Responsibilities/Duties:   Purchase Order Management:       o Create and manage purchase orders in accordance with established procurement guidelines.   o Verify purchase requisitions, ensuring accuracy and compliance with policies and budgetary constraints.   o Monitor purchase orders to track delivery status, resolve any issues, and ensure timely receipt of goods and services.   o Collaborate with suppliers and internal stakeholders to manage changes, cancellations, and returns as necessary.       Supplier Relationship Management:        o Maintain positive and professional relationships with suppliers, acting as a primary point of contact.   o Monitor supplier performance, including delivery times, quality, and adherence to contractual agreements.   o Collaborate with the procurement team to evaluate and assess supplier performance on an ongoing basis.       Compliance and Process Improvement:        o Ensure compliance with procurement policies, procedures, and regulatory requirements.   o Assist in the development and enhancement of procurement processes and workflows.   o Identify areas for process improvement, automation, or standardization within the procurement function   o Participate in cross-functional teams to support procurement-related projects and initiatives

column2: Role & responsibilities    Managing the end-to-end procurement process for consumables and mechanical components, including raising RFQs, price comparison, negotiation, PO creation, vendor coordination, and follow-up, as well as handling logistics until receipt of material. Additionally, overseeing the end-to-end procurement process for manufacturing and support function services such as powder coating, QC  Calibration, and HR Admin services. Also, managing the project-based procurement process for machined parts, sheet metal, MS raw material, etc., and coordinating with vendors for quality-related issues. Handling logistics arrangements for imported material and submitting necessary periodic reports as required. Managing entries related to material allocation in ERP and facilitating inter-department coordination and communication effectively, for instance, conducting project review meetings with the Production Dept. Preferred candidate profile   Excellent coordination and follow-up skills are a must. Good negotiation and cost estimation skills are mandatory. column2: Vendor Identification and Evaluation:            Conduct market research to identify potential vendors and suppliers in the logistics industry.      Evaluate vendors based on predefined criteria such as capabilities, capacity, quality standards, financial stability, and track record.      Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand their requirements and align vendor selection accordingly.            Vendor Negotiation and Contracting:            Negotiate favorable terms, pricing, and contracts with vendors, ensuring cost efficiency and value for the company.      Establish and maintain mutually beneficial relationships with vendors, fostering collaboration and continuous improvement.      Monitor and enforce vendor compliance with contractual obligations, service level agreements, and quality standards.            Vendor Performance Management:            Define and implement vendor performance metrics and KPIs to assess vendor performance regularly.      Conduct periodic vendor performance reviews, addressing any issues or concerns, and identifying areas for improvement.      Collaborate with vendors to drive continuous improvement initiatives and optimize service levels.            Vendor Risk Management:            Identify and mitigate potential risks associated with vendor relationships, such as financial instability, quality issues, or disruptions in the supply chain.      Develop and implement risk mitigation strategies, including contingency plans and alternative sourcing options.            Market Analysis and Benchmarking:            Stay updated with industry trends, market dynamics, and emerging technologies related to logistics and vendor management.      Conduct benchmarking exercises to compare vendor performance, pricing, and service quality against industry standards.            Collaboration and Cross-functional Support:            Collaborate with internal stakeholders, including operations, procurement, and finance teams, to understand their requirements and align vendor selection accordingly.      Provide support and guidance to cross-functional teams regarding vendor-related matters, fostering effective communication and collaboration.          Who You Are          Must be a Hindi speaking candidate.      Bachelors degree in supply chain management, logistics, business administration, or a related field. Relevant certifications are a plus.      Minimum 5 years proven experience in vendor management, sourcing, or procurement within the logistics or supply chain industry.      Strong knowledge of logistics operations, vendor evaluation methodologies, and negotiation strategies.      Excellent analytical skills and ability to interpret data to drive decision-making.      Strong negotiation and communication skills, with the ability to build and maintain relationships with vendors and internal stakeholders.      Familiarity with logistics platforms, software, and tools is preferred.      Proactive and results-oriented mindset, with the ability to work independently and handle multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.

column2: Job Summary: The Purchase Manager is responsible for overseeing the procurement process of all medical and non-medical supplies required for the hospital. This includes negotiating with suppliers, managing inventory, ensuring timely delivery of supplies, and maintaining cost-effective purchasing practices. Key Responsibilities: 1. Procurement Planning and Management:    - Develop and implement procurement strategies to ensure timely and cost-effective acquisition of all hospital supplies.    - Monitor inventory levels and forecast supply needs in coordination with various departments. 2. Supplier Management:    - Identify, evaluate, and establish relationships with suppliers and vendors.    - Negotiate contracts, prices, and terms with suppliers to secure advantageous terms.    - Conduct supplier performance evaluations and maintain a preferred supplier list. 3. Compliance and Quality Assurance:    - Ensure all purchased supplies comply with hospital standards and regulations.    - Coordinate with the Quality Assurance team to conduct inspections and quality checks on received supplies.    - Maintain up-to-date knowledge of market trends, changes in regulations, and new products. 4.Budget Management:    - Prepare and manage the procurement budget, ensuring cost-effectiveness and adherence to financial guidelines.    - Track and report on spending and procurement activities, identifying areas for cost savings. 5. Inventory Control:    - Oversee the hospital's inventory management system to ensure optimal stock levels.    - Implement inventory control procedures to prevent overstocking and shortages. 6. Documentation and Reporting:    - Maintain accurate records of all procurement transactions and supplier contracts.    - Generate regular reports on procurement activities, expenditures, and savings. 7. Team Leadership:    - Supervise and train purchasing staff, providing guidance and support as needed.    - Foster a collaborative and efficient working environment within the purchasing team. Qualifications: - Bachelor's degree in Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or a related field. - Minimum of 5 years of experience in procurement or supply chain management, preferably in a healthcare setting. - Strong negotiation and communication skills. - Proficiency in procurement software and inventory management systems. - Excellent organizational and multitasking abilities. - Knowledge of healthcare regulations and standards is a plus. Key Competencies: - Analytical thinking and problem-solving. - Attention to detail and accuracy. - Leadership and team management skills. - Strong ethical standards and integrity. - Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines. Working Conditions: - This role typically involves working in an office environment within the hospital. - Occasional travel may be required for supplier meetings and conferences.
